RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 62. Maiden Claiming Purse 18100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Weight, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, if for $22,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ALL THAT MAGIC vied for the early lead three wide, made a bid to shake clear on the turn and drop to the inside, then drew off leaving the turn to prove much the best under a drive. SUNSHINE LINDA vied for the early lead up the inside, then saved ground on the turn while stalking, shifted off the inside in the lane and held the place award. DUST BUNNY was allowed to settle on the inside, angled out in the drive and lacked the needed rally, bested rest. LET'S GO MO was bumped at the start, then settled early and was between rivals at the half mile marker, then lacked a rally. BABY BLUE was reserved early, swung out five wide leaving the turn and passed the tiring rivals. SCOREBOARD LILY vied for the early lead between rivals, then stalked the winner three wide by the quarter pole and then weakened. HOLLI THE DOLLY broke outwardly at the start, chased the pace four wide and then was three wide on the turn and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Sunshine Linda
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied inside, saved ground turn, shift 2 wide 3/16, held place

ENTRY.NAME: Dust Bunny
ENTRY.OWNER: Short Straw Stable and Davis Kelly
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, inside turn, angled out, bested rest

ENTRY.NAME: Baby Blue
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, swung 5 wide, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: All That Magic
ENTRY.OWNER: Pewter Stable and Spedale Family Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied 3 wide, shook clear inside turn, drew off stretch, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Let's Go Mo
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, settled between horses 1/2, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Scoreboard Lily
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied between horses, 3 wide turn, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Holli the Dolly
ENTRY.OWNER: Cramer David and Triple B Stables LLC (Ryter)
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke outwardly, chased pace 4 wide, weakened,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 1M Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 10800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since December 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ONCE A GIANT was four wide into the first turn, rated early making way to the inside by the eleven sixteenth, made a inside move on the turn and vied for command by the quarter pole, then drew off in the lane to prove much the best, driving. BUFF AND SHINE vied for the early lead three wide, then stalked the pace on the backstretch, made a three wide bid on the turn to vie for command by the quarter pole but proved to be no match for the winner while staying on to be second best. BRANTLEYS BIG GUN was allowed to settle early, advanced on the inside on the turn, angled out five wide leaving the quarter pole, then had no late kick, bested rest. JUMP FREE vied for the early lead and then went on to set the pace while in the two path, then was headed nearing the quarter pole and weakened. ICHIGO was allowed to settle early on the inside and lacked a rally. BLACK IRISH was reserved early, four wide on the turn and had no rally. HAYROLL chased the pace four wide, then made a mild bid three wide on the turn but tired. WHATA GUY was reserved early, dropped to the inside on the turn and was not a threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Black Irish
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, 4 wide turn, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Ichigo
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle inside, lacked rally

ENTRY.NAME: Brantleys Big Gun
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, inside turn, angled out 5 wide 1/4, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Jump Free
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied early, set pace backstretch, headed 1/4, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Hayroll
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 4 wide, mild bid 3 wide turn, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Buff and Shine
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied 3 wide, stalked 3 wide, bid 3 wide, no match, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Whata Guy
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, inside 1/4 pole, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Once a Giant
ENTRY.OWNER: On The Rise Again Stable and Our Blue Streaks Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4 wide first turn, rated, inside bid, drew off stretch, driving,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 53. Maiden Claiming Purse 13600. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Weight, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FORECLOSURE was rated along early, made a three wide move on the turn, then hit the front leaving the furlong marker and slowly edged away to prove best, driving. RUN AWAY EMPIRE set the pace while clear down the backstretch, was headed by the furlong marker and dug in but was outkicked while being second best. BENCH PRESS was reserved early, made a inside move on the turn to move into contention but flattened out in the lane, held show award. MR. REDOLFO was allowed to settle early, came five wide into the lane and lacked the needed rally, missed show award. FLAT BUSTED tracked the early pace and was two to three wide on the backstretch, weakened. FINNOGGINDUDE chased the pace four wide and tired. FIRE D'ROCKET stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Fire d'Rocket
ENTRY.COMMENT: stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Flat Busted
ENTRY.OWNER: Short Straw Stable and Martin Kaci
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace inside, 2 wide turn, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Run Away Empire
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, clear backstretch, headed 1/8, outkicked, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Foreclosure
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated early, 3 wide move, edged away late, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Bench Press
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, inside, move turn, flattened out, held show

ENTRY.NAME: Finnoggindude
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 4 wide, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Redolfo
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, came 5 wide, needed rally, missed 3rd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 14400. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, if for $9,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AGGRANDIZE was allowed to settle early two wide, made a inside move nearing the quarter pole, then drew out in the drive to prove much the best, driving. MONEYONTHELINE was rated along early three wide, made a four wide move on the turn, but proved to be no match for the winner while clearly second best. D'STORM set the pace while in the two path, then was headed leaving the turn and weakened, held show award. MISCHIEVIOUSBUD stalked the pace three wide and was ridden along on the turn but came up empty, missed show award. DIXIE CANNONBALL was settled early and four wide on the turn and had no rally. BUSTER BRUNO lacked a rally. GERONIMO failed to menace. NOTORIOUS REY saved ground to no avail.

ENTRY.NAME: Notorious Rey
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, saved ground, no avail

ENTRY.NAME: D'storm
ENTRY.OWNER: Short Straw Stable and Fountain Springs Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, 2 wide turn, weakened, held show

ENTRY.NAME: Buster Bruno
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, lacked rally

ENTRY.NAME: Geronimo
ENTRY.OWNER: Spicer, Richard and Spitler, D. William
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Moneyontheline
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated 3 wide, bid 4 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Mischieviousbud
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, ridden along turn, empty,

ENTRY.NAME: Aggrandize
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, inside move, drew out stretch, driving,

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Brent Fernung, Crystal Fernung & Exaggerator Syndicate

ENTRY.NAME: Dixie Cannonball
ENTRY.OWNER: Tribe Dawg LLC and Kline Thomas
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 4 wide turn, no rally,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 78. Claiming Purse 11800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JULY 13 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since December 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since November 13 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STRAIGHT UP GUY was reserved early, made a five wide move on the far turn, hit the front nearing the furlong marker and drew clear to prove best under a drive. DAKOTA OUTLAW was rated along three wide, made a four wide bid on the turn and led leaving the turn but could not fgo with the winner, second best. ALPHA SIXTY SIX was in tight into the first turn, then shifted to the outside to stalk the pace two to three wide, made a bid between rivals by the quarter pole but weakened, held show award. FIFTY SHEAS OFGREY set a fast pace on the inside, was headed by the quarter pole, angled out in the lane and missed the show award. ELEVATED FOREVER was void of early speed while four wide, came wide into the ;lane and had a belated rally. MIDDLE EARTH was allowed to settle early, was on the inside on the turn and tired. MASTER OF WAR had no speed and was not a threat. DEVIOUS BANKER chased the pace on the inside and tired. WICKED CRAZY was five wide into the first turn, chased the pace five wide and was roused leaving the half mile marker and stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Alpha Sixty Six
ENTRY.COMMENT: in tight first turn, stalked 2 wide, bid between 1/4, faded,

ENTRY.NAME: Fifty Sheas Ofgrey
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace pace inside, headed 1/4, angled out, missed show

ENTRY.NAME: Straight Up Guy
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, 5 wide move, drew clear, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Devious Banker
ENTRY.OWNER: Cramer David and Triple B Stables LLC (Ryter)
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Middle Earth
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, inside 2nd turn, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked Crazy
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5 wide first turn, chased 5 wide, roused 1/2, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Elevated Forever
ENTRY.COMMENT: void early speed, 4 wide 5/8 pole, came wide, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Dakota Outlaw
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated 3 wide, bid 4 wide, no match, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Master of War
ENTRY.COMMENT: void early speed, no threat,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 82. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 28900. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 13 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 13 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $25,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AMERICAN PYRAMID dueled for the lead outside, made a three wide bid to draw clear on the turn, then was confronted by the furlong marker and dug in gamely to hold on to prove best, driving. MOONSAFE was rated between rivals early, made a three wide bid nearing the quarter pole, loomed boldly by the furlong marker but hung late. TIMELY TRADITION chased the early pace on the inside, then was three wide by the quarter pole while making a mild bid, but finished evenly late. BRAMBLE BUSH was bumped at the start, then was allowed to settle early, came six wide into the lane and improved position late. HONORABLE LILLY tracked the early pace three wide and in between rivals, then was two wide by the quarter pole and weakened. JACKIE THE JOKER chased the pace four to five wide and was empty in the lane. BETTY'S SMILE dueled for the lead on the inside and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Betty's Smile
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled inside, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Timely Tradition
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, 3 wide 1/4 pole, mild bid, even finish

ENTRY.NAME: Honorable Lilly
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, 2 wide 1/4 pole, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Moonsafe
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated between horses, bid 3 wide, hung late

ENTRY.NAME: Bramble Bush
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, allowed to settle, came 6 wide, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Jackie the Joker
ENTRY.OWNER: Fanelli John LC Racing LLC and Longball Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 4 wide, came 5 wide, empty,

ENTRY.NAME: American Pyramid
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled outside, bid 3 wide, clear turn inside,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 1M Dirt CR: 80. Allowance Purse 31600. FOR REGISTERED PA-BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A PA-RESTRICTED RACE(S) OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since December 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since November 13 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DEE JAY pulled early, split rivals nearing the eleven sixteenths to go on and set the pace while in the two path, drew out on the turn and then drew off in the stretch to prove much the best while being hand ridden. LTL BEAR SALOON tracked the early pace in between rivals, then chased the winner three wide on the turn and proved to be no match for that rival while second best. SIR REX was five wide into the first turn, settled in three to four wide, made a mild bid four wide on the turn but failed to gain in the lane, bested rest. OVER AND THUNDER stalked the pace four wide and weakened. E T'S SUPER STAR lacked a rally. FED CHAIR set a pressured pace early on the inside, then tracked the winner on the backstretch on the inside and tired. LOUIE'S LAW was bumped at the start, then failed to menace.

ENTRY.NAME: Dee Jay
ENTRY.COMMENT: pulled early, split 11/16, pace 5/8, clear turn, drew off,handily

ENTRY.NAME: Fed Chair
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace inside, tracked inside backstretch, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Ltl Bear Saloon
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace between horses, 3 wide 1/4 pole, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: E T's Super Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, lacked rally

ENTRY.NAME: Over and Thunder
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 4 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Louie's Law
ENTRY.OWNER: Aurora Vista LLC and Golden Oak Farm LLC (Stepanoff)
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Sir Rex
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5 wide first turn, settled 3 wide, mild bid 4 wide, bested rest
